properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Christmas at the Cathedral will take place over 12 days in the forecourt of St Mary’s Cathedral, from Thursday 14 to Monday 25 December. The event will run each night between 5:30pm and 10:30pm. The night will have food stalls, live entertainment, and a light show.

College St between Prince Albert Rd and Park St outside the Cathedral will remain open throughout the event however road closures may be implemented under Police discretion for crowd safety.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, and watch our for increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

webLinks.linkText: Let the Good Times Roll Festival

properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling Sets Music Festival will be held on Saturday 9 December at Entrance Memorial Park with up to 8000 attendees expected. Let the Good Times Roll Festival will be held at the same location on Sunday 10 December with up to 5000 concert goers anticipated.


Marine Parade from Beach Street to Duffys Lane will be closed on Saturday from 10am to 10pm and on Sunday from 11.30am to 8pm.
properties.diversions: Local road detours will be in place with traffic management.

properties.publicTransport: ﻿Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
50 Cent at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday 8 and Saturday 9 December. Support acts from 7pm, main act at 8:30pm and show finished around 10:45pm.

Significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct on Saturday night as a combined crowd of 100,000 is expected to attend events in Olympic Park across the evening. Traffic will also be busy on Friday during the busy evening peak.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Parking in the precinct will be in high demand and is likely to sell out in advance. Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Perth Wilcats. Tip-off at 7:30pm, full time around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to the game in the busy Friday evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close to help crowds move safely around the area.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists are advised to allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Men's Big Bash League: Sydney Sixers v Melbourne Renegades at the SCG. Start of play 7:15pm, end of play 10:10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match in the busy Friday evening peak. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 4:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 4:15pm). EP2 Kippax car par will not be open for this match.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Macarthur FC at Allianz Stadium. Kick-Off at 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Road and cycleway closures

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave however access to EP3 grass car park, EP2 car park and drop off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd. Please note EP2 parking is very limited due to upgrade works.
  • Closures may be in place on the Moore Park Rd / Fitzroy St cycleway before and after the game to allow for the safe movement of pedestrians to and from the stadium.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

NBL: Sydney Kings v SE Melbourne Phoenix at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip-off from 3:45pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park including on the M4, Parramatta Road, Homebush Bay Drive and Concord Road as basketball fans travel to and from the game. 

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

Significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct as a combined crowd of more than 100,000 is expected to attend events in Olympic Park across the evening.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Parking in the precinct will be in high demand and is likely to sell out in advance. Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

properties.otherAdvice:
Foo Fighters concert at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open at 4:15pm, main act from 8pm, finish around 11pm.

Significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct as a combined crowd of more than 100,000 is expected to attend multiple events in Olympic Park across the evening.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Parking in the precinct will be in high demand and is likely to sell out in advance. Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Melbourne Victory at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 6:55pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. Melbourne Victory

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Ingham Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:20pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice: Gunnedah Christmas Fair will be held on Kamilaroi Highway (Conadilly Street), on Thursday 7 December from 5.30pm.
properties.diversions: Kamilaroi Highway (Conadilly Street) will be closed between 3pm and 11pm with detours via Abbott, Bloomfield and Tempest Streets.

properties.otherAdvice: The Kyogle Christmas Party will be held on Friday 8 December.
properties.diversions: The Summerland Way will be closed between 3pm and 8pm with detours from Wyangarie Street to Anzac Drive.

properties.otherAdvice: Christmas on Kelly Street will be held on Thursday 14 December.
properties.diversions: Kelly Street will be closed between 5pm and 9pm with detours via Kingdon, Main and Susan Streets.

webLinks.linkText: New Year's Eve at The Entrance

properties.otherAdvice: The Entrance will come alive on New Year's Eve to celebrate the last day of 2023 featuring live music, food trucks and roving entertainment from 5.30pm at Memorial Park. There will be a fireworks display at 9pm with expected attendance of 12,000 people at the festivities.
properties.diversions: Marine Parade and Victoria Avenue will be closed between 3pm and 11pm with police controlling traffic at the Wilfred Barrett Drive and Duffys Lane intersection.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Western United at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off from 7:45pm, full time around 9:35pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game in the busy evening peak

Dane Dr will close before the match from 5:45pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.
New Year's Eve will be a free celebration held at the Leagues Club Park in Gosford from 5pm with live music, kids' entertainment, food vendors and fireworks display at 9pm.
properties.diversions: With up to 5000 attendees expected, there will be impacts to the Central Coast Highway with surrounding streets closed including Vaughan Avenue, Baker Street and Alfred Higgs Place, Graham Park from 6am until 10pm.

properties.publicTransport:
Event attendees are encouraged to use public transport, with North Wollongong station located a short walk from the venue.

Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 5000 attendees are expected for the North Gong Pub Santa Pub Crawl on Saturday 10 December.

1 of 3 southbound lanes will be closed on the Princes Highway at North Wollongong with a reduced 40km/h speed limit.

Motorists driving in the area should reduce speed and allow extra travel time.
properties.displayName: North Gong Hotel Santa Pub Crawl

properties.otherAdvice:
Speed reduction and stop slow traffic control will be in place at various locations along Kosciuszko Road between Jindabyne and Charlottes Pass

Motorists driving in the area should reduce speed, allow extra travel time and exercise caution as there will be participants on foot.
The annual Cobar Christmas Parade and Gala Night will be held on Friday 8 December between 6pm and 10pm in the main CBD of Cobar.
properties.diversions: The Barrier Hwy will be closed to facilitate the event. All traffic will be detoured via Lewis St, Louth Rd and Frederick St. Detour is suitable for all vehicles.
properties.displayName: Cobar Christmas Parade and Gala Night

properties.otherAdvice: The annual Warren Christmas Street Party will be held on Thursday 8 December from 6pm to 9.30pm in the main street of Warren (Dubbo St).
properties.diversions:
The Oxley Hwy will be closed between Dubbo Street and Cobb Lane.

Light vehicles detoured via Thornton Av, Readford St and Lawson St.

Heavy vehicles detoured via Industrial Access Rd.

properties.otherAdvice: Hosted by Lake Macquarie City Council, Lake Mac Carols will be held at Speers Point Park from 5-9pm.
properties.diversions: The Esplanade will have a reduced speed limit from 3pm and will be closed to northbound traffic around 8.30pm with a detour via Main Road to clear traffic from the event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A series of concerts will be held at the Sydney Opera House forecourt with thousands of fans expected to attend each show.

  • Wed 6 to Friday 8 Dec - Dermot Kennedy
  • Sat 9 Dec - Synthony
  • Sun 10 and Mon 11 Dec - Guy Sebastian
  • Tue 12 Dec - Ice House
  • Wed 13 Dec - Human Nature

Motorists should allow extra travel time as delays are expected along Macquarie St and Bridge St approaching the Opera House car park and drop off area.

webLinks.linkText: Inner West Council - New Year's Eve 2023

properties.publicTransport: Buses may be using different routes and stops. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year's Eve in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

  • From 3pm roads closures will be in place on sections of Ballast Point Rd, Brent St, Darling St, Evan St, Joseph St, Hartley St, Hanover St, Loughlin St, Mackenzie St, Mansfield St, McKell St, Mullen St, Rose St, Terry St, The Crescent, Waragal Ave, Wharf Rd and Yeend St.
  • There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm. Access will be maintained for Balmain Access Permit holders on select roads with passes, buses, taxis and other authorised vehicles only. Roads will reopen from 12:30am on New Year's Day or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Traffic may be heavy exiting the area so be patient or delay your travel.
  • From 8.30pm to 9.30pm and from 11pm to 12.30am Anzac Bridge citybound lanes will be closed. The Sydney Harbour Bridge will remain closed to general traffic until 1.30am.

Special event clearways are in effect on Victoria Rd from The Crescent, Rozelle to Westbourne St, Drummoyne (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD. From 1pm extended no-parking bus zones will be in effect on sections of Darling St and Grove St, and no-stopping zones will be in effect on sections of Montague St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.﻿

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

BALMAIN PENINSULA (BALMAIN/BIRCHGROVE/ROZELLE)

The following roads will be closed to all vehicular traffic entering the Balmain peninsula except Transport for NSW (TfNSW), Buses, Taxis, Hire Cars and Balmain Access Permit holders and will be manned by NSW Police officers. Council has liaised with the police to ensure that taxis will be allowed access to the peninsula on New Years Eve. However, taxi access after 7pm will require the passenger to have information verifying that they are a resident of the Balmain peninsula.

For more information on local council closures visit the Inner West Council website.

Road closures and clearways will be in place for New Year's Eve (NYE) at Taronga Zoo in Mosman. Parking is very limited in the area and Zoo parking will fill quickly, consider the public transport options.

  • From 3pm NYE until 2am New Year's Day (NYD): Bradleys Head Rd and Athol Wharf Rd approaching the Zoo will be closed.
  • From 11:30pm NYE until 2am NYD: sections of Bradley's Head Rd, Prince Albert St, Thompson St and Whiting Beach Rd will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect at the following times and locations:

  • From 1pm NYE until 3am NYD on sections of Spit Rd, Athol Wharf Rd, Bradley Head Rd and Whiting Beach Rd.
  • From 6pm NYE to 3am NYD on sections of Military Rd near Belmont Rd and Mandolong Rd.
  • Clearways will also be in effect along Falcon St and Military Rd between Spit Rd, Mosman and the Pacific Hwy, Crows Nest on both sides from 3pm NYE until 3am NYD

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Gabriel Iglesias at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts around 7pm, finishes approx. 10:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to and from the concert.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the interactive map.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains, light rail and metro is included in event tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Traffic is heavy in the Entertainment Quarter, and parking is reaching capacity. Those attending the event are strongly advised to consider public transport options.

Good Things Festival at Brazilian Fields in Centennial Park. Event runs from 12pm to 10pm.

With up to 35,000 music fans expected, and an A-League match at neighbouring Allianz Stadium finishing around the same time, traffic in the area will be heavy before and after the event.

Motorists should expect delays on roads around and approaching Centennial Park and Moore Park, including on Anzac Pde, Lang Rd, Oxford St, Syd Einfeld Drive, Darley Rd, York Rd and Alison Rd as a large number of vehicle pick-ups and drop-offs are expected. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity on local roads will be higher than usual.

Changed traffic conditions and road closures will be in place:

  • Between 8pm and midnight sections of Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd and Driver Ave will close to allow crowds to safely leave the festival.
  • Access to the Entertainment Quarter from 8pm to midnight will be via Oatley Rd, Renny St, Gordon St and Cook Rd only. No access from Lang Rd at Anzac Pde or Oxford St.
  • Centennial Park internal road and gate closures will also be in place.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and Centennial Park between 6am and midnight on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Oxford St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St. On Driver Ave clearways will be in effect for 24 hours on Saturday. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SATURDAY 2 DECEMBER

MOORE PARK – 8PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • ​​Driver Avenue between ​Lang Road​ and ​the NRL Building (both directions)
  • Note: a section of Driver Avenue will already be closed from 5:45pm
  • ​​Lang Road* between Anzac Parade and ​Errol Flynn Boulevard (eastbound)
  • Lang Road between Erroly Flynn Boulevard and Driver Avenue (westbound)
  • Lang Road** between Oxford Street and Mitchell Street (both directions)
  • Moore Park Road between Oxford Street and Cook Road (westbound)

*Vehicles will be allowed to exit EP3 car park and turn right on to Lang Road to join Anzac Parade. 

**Managed access to/from the Entertainment Quarter via Oatley Road, Renny Street and Cook Road.

MOORE PARK – 9PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Moore Park Road between Oatley Road and Oxford Street (eastbound)

MOORE PARK – 12:01AM TO 4AM DAILY // SATURDAY 2 & SUNDAY 3 DECEMBER

  • Driver Avenue between Lang Road and the southern turning circle (both directions)

CYCLEWAY CLOSURE

9PM TO 10:30PM

  • The Moore Park Road cycleway will be closed between Regent Street and Oatley Road​​

CENTENNIAL PARK – ALL DAY ROAD CLOSURES

  • Parkes Drive from Paddington Gates to Dickens Drive
  • Hamilton Drive
  • Dickens Drive east of Parkes Drive to Grand Drive
  • Jervois Ave
  • Loch Avenue South*
  • Horse Track will be closed from Robertson Road Gates at the Chicane past Café Corner to Loch Avenue.**

*Closed from Friday 24 November to Wednesday 6 December.

**In addition, Centennial Parklands will be closed to all equestrian use from 10.30am on Saturday 2 December. Horses are not permitted to enter the Parklands after 10am and all riders are to be offsite by 10.30am.

CENTENNIAL PARK – GATE CLOSURES

  • Closed from 6pm: all Centennial Park vehicle gates will close at 6pm, except for:
  • Closed all day: Paddington Gates, Woollahra Gates and Jervois Gates
  • Closed from 12pm: Govett Street Entry Gate and Robertson Road Exit Gate

properties.otherAdvice:
Boiler Room Festival at Sydney Showground. Event starts at 3pm and finishes at midnight.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as attendees travel to and from the event.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the interactive map.

Visit Sydney Olympic Park Parking to pre-book your parking ticket and guarantee yourself a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

roads.mainStreet: Edwin Flack Avenue, Kevin Coombs Avenue and Australia Avenue

properties.otherAdvice: The Central Coast Christmas Fair will be held at Mingara Recreation Club on Wyong Road with approximately 5000 attendees expected between 9am and 2pm.
Up to 2000 visitors are expected at Lago di Mac Italian celebration to be held on Sunday 3 December at Thomas H Halton Park and Croudace Bay Park on Macquarie Drive, Lake Macquarie.
Bikers Toy Run from Ballast Grounds Stockton to Connolly Park Carrington for the motorcycle convoy.
Milthorpe Markets will be held on Sunday 3 December from 8.30am to 3.00pm. Church St and Crowson St will be closed from Pearce St to Milthorpe Rd and traffic control will be in attendance.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne Victory at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off from 3pm, full time around 4:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 1pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Adelaide United at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 5pm, full time approx 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: There is no on-site parking available at either golf club, catch transport instead. Shuttle buses will run from Mascot Station, UNSW Light Rail Stop, Royal Randwick Car Park and to the golf courses for the event. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
ISPS HANDA Australian Golf Open from Thursday 30 November to Sunday 3 December. Event takes place at The Australian Golf Club in Rosebery (Thursday to Sunday) and The Lakes Golf Club in Eastlakes (Thursday to Friday).

Traffic may be heavier than usual in the area during the event. Allow extra travel time.

Special event clearways and temporary bus zones will be in effect:

  • Rosebery and Kensington, Thursday to Sunday: Special event clearways will be in effect between 5am and 8pm daily from Thursday to Sunday on sections of Bannerman Cres and Trevilyan Ave in Rosebery and Tunstall Ave in Kensington.
  • Mascot, Thursday to Sunday: Temporary bus zones (no-parking permitted) will be in effect on the eastern side of Coward St (east of Laycock Walk) and on the eastern side of King St (near Park on King at #336)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sustainable Christmas Market at The Coal Loader Centre for Sustainability. Event starts at 3pm and finishes at 8pm.

Roads are expected to be busy in the area and parking near the event is limited.

Motorists are advised to travel with their group and plan to arrive early to secure a parking space.
